title: The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Apps & Platforms Winners
description: Winning the Professional Apps & Platforms category is the WE: Wellness Support for Non-Native Speaking Women project from QIMU Design. WE is an innovative platform designed to empower immigrant women by breaking down barriers in healthcare access. WE addresses the challenges using a user-centered design that combines cutting-edge technology and human connection, ensuring healthcare becomes accessible, supportive, and empowering The winning Student entry in Apps & Platforms went to Voice Select from Malte Fial and Johannes Roghkegel at Hochschule für Gestaltung Schwäbisch Gmünd. This platform uses a smartphone application that empowers users to manually select and prioritize voices in group settings and is designed to accommodate the highly individual nature of hearing impairments by offering multiple levels of customization.The jury team for the 2025 Apps & Platforms category was led by Jury Captain Jodi Cutler senior design director at H-E-B. Cutler led a team that included Adriana Morales a Design Principal at H-E-B, Maui Francis the UX Manager & Design Lead at Google, and Kathryn Marinaro who is Creative Director at argodesign.The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Apps & Platforms category includes software applications that help users perform a specific task, such as writing documents, playing games, or watching videos. html:
The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Apps & Platforms Winners

Jodi Cutler the Senior Design Director at H-E-B led this jury team

By Core Jr - June 24

in

Core77 Design Awards | design awards | Apps

Winning the Professional Apps & Platforms category is the WE: Wellness Support for Non-Native Speaking Women project from QIMU Design. WE is an innovative platform designed to empower immigrant women by breaking down barriers in healthcare access. WE addresses the challenges using a user-centered design that combines cutting-edge technology and human connection, ensuring healthcare becomes accessible, supportive, and empowering

The winning Student entry in Apps & Platforms went to Voice Select from Malte Fial and Johannes Roghkegel at Hochschule für Gestaltung Schwäbisch Gmünd. This platform uses a smartphone application that empowers users to manually select and prioritize voices in group settings and is designed to accommodate the highly individual nature of hearing impairments by offering multiple levels of customization.

The jury team for the 2025 Apps & Platforms category was led by Jury Captain Jodi Cutler senior design director at H-E-B. Cutler led a team that included Adriana Morales a Design Principal at H-E-B, Maui Francis the UX Manager & Design Lead at Google, and Kathryn Marinaro who is Creative Director at argodesign.

The 2025 Core77 Design Awards Apps & Platforms category includes software applications that help users perform a specific task, such as writing documents, playing games, or watching videos. It includes web or mobile screen-based software programs designed for us

Apps & Platforms Award Honorees

  • Pro Winner

    WE: Wellness Support for Non-Native Speaking Women

    By QIMU Design

  • Pro Runner Up

    AlzCare – Empowering Families through Alzheimer’s Caregiving Journey

    By AlzCare

  • Pro Runner Up

    Speechlab Dubbing

    By Speechlab, Inc.

  • Pro Notable

    Chartmetric Mobile App: Redefining Data-Driven Music Insights on the Go

  • Student Winner

    By Malte Fial

  • Student Runner Up
